title: Evert Bloemsma passed away over the weekend.
content:
A great loss occurred to the typographic community this past weekend. Evert had already given us such great typefaces. From his last few posts on Typophile, one could easily tell that he was a very generous and kind man with much more to share. He will be greatly missed.

 [‹ Recommendations Welcome](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009131054/http:/typophile.com/node/14632 "Go to previous forum topic") [Evert Bloemsma - Questions ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009131054/http:/typophile.com/node/14439 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content:
That's truly a great loss. My deepest condolence to Evert's family. I have had a very insightful conversation with Evert last year. He was a wonderful man.   
   
Adam
I have no words, this is so sad. This is a great loss indeed. ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009131054im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)

I can't believe it -- just last week I re-read some of his articles on his site... Inspiring, knowledgable, eclectic.   
In my mind Evert is one of the truly original type designers and his death is a great loss.   
Was, of course. D\*\*\* shame.

PostScript: I Googled Evert's first post here (just over half way down this page);   
   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/41830.html?1094659721](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009131054/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/41830.html?1094659721)

I am deeply saddened by the loss of this young and gifted designer. But, more than anything, the world has lost a kind and warm person who contributed greatly to our community and to those around him. My deepest sympathies to his family.
What sad news this is. Evert was one of those type designers who really raised the bar for the rest of us.

The rarest combination of intellect and kindness.   
It's hard to know which half we should be sad about more.   
   
The more time passes, the more we will owe him, I have no doubt.   
   
hhp

Erik Spiekermann sent the following to news{at}typophile.com.   
This note is especially appropriate for this thread given Erik and   
Jan Middendorp's relationship with Evert Bloemsma.   
   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

> * * *
> **quote:**
> 
> Evert Bloemsma, 1958

And again I miss him.

As his students we all wrote a few lines to commemorate him. I described him as a genius wearing a workman’s overall of modesty. (’Een genie in een stofjas van bescheidenheid’) It doesn’t translate well into English, but this is what he was.

I seriously doubt I will meet a person combining total seriousness with gentle playfullness in that way ever again.

——————————————————————————  
My work is a game. A very serious game [M.C. Escher]
